Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: This crumbling shrine of Lutara has seen the passage of ages and yet still stands strong in its hidden grove. The stone, respectfully carved, is not a mineral known to any living person. It is black and grey with streaks and splotches of every color reflecting from its surface. Cracks and fissures almost completely decimate it but the nearby growth of vines have permeated these gaping wounds to tie them together once more. It is as if the very life of the grove is dependant upon the shrine and the life of the shrine upon the grove. It is not uncommon for believers to dedicate objects or even themselves to the shrine.
